page.title: 04THE WILDLIFE OF POOLE FARM
page.content: Poole Farm provides habitats for wildlife.A few uncommon plants like Yellow Rattle and Early Purple Orchid grow here.Bluebell,Foxglove,Campion and nettle all grow in the hedgerows which consist of Oak, Hawthorn and other trees. On the farm there are ten acres of broad leaved woodland inhabited by Fox,Badger,Squirrel,Rabbit and other small mammals and some birds. Fallow deer from Plym Forest ,have also been seen. Swallow,Sparrow and Dove,all nest in the farm buildings while Kingfisher and Heron have been seen near the streams.The areas of Bracken in the fields provide nesting sites for birds but these soon will be removed. The farmer Mr.Horswell has no plans for removing either hedgerows or woodland.
